events.message: Customer reported a car collision involving their vehicle and filed the initial claim through the online portal.
The submitted claim was categorised under 'Auto Accident' due to keywords identifying vehicle collision damage.
An experienced auto insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's claim and provide assistance.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim had been officially acknowledged by the insurer.
Requested police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report and images of the damage to the insurance portal.
The claims department began a formal investigation to verify the circumstances and validate the coverage.
Investigation concluded confirming the collision details matched customer’s report and claim eligibility.
A settlement proposal including repair costs and compensation was sent to the customer for review and approval.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and confirmed acceptance of the offer.
The claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the settlement proposal by the claims team.
Payment for the approved claim amount was issued to the customer’s account within the standard processing timeframe.
The claim file was officially closed after payment was issued and the customer confirmed receipt of the funds.
Completed claim documents and records were archived in the system for future reference and auditing purposes.
